qas.question: What did a red flag signal in the Middle Ages?

answers.text: defenders of a town or castle would fight to defend it

qas.question: What was the importance of a red flag flown by a warship in the Middle Ages?

answers.text: they would show no mercy to their enemy

qas.question: Which British law forbade cars from following a bearer of a red flag as a warning to horse drawn vehicles?
Under what circimstance is a red flag flown in auto racing?

answers.text: if there is danger to the drivers

qas.question: What is a football player shown before being ejected from a match?

plausible_answers.text: in the early days of motoring, motor cars had to follow a man with a red flag who would warn horse-drawn vehicles

qas.question: What did the Highway Act of 1869 abolish?

plausible_answers.text: a player who has made a serious violation of the rules is shown a red penalty card and ejected from the game.

qas.question: What does a red flag signify in football?

plausible_answers.text: man with a red flag who would warn horse-drawn vehicles

qas.question: What did motor cars have to follow in the Middle Ages?

context: Red is the traditional color of warning and danger. In the Middle Ages, a red flag announced that the <a0_0>defenders of a town or castle would fight to defend it<a0_0/>, and a red flag hoisted by a warship meant <a1_0>they would show no mercy to their enemy<a1_0/>. In Britain, <b5_0>in the early days of motoring, motor cars had to follow a <b7_0>man with a red flag who would warn horse-drawn vehicles<b7_0/><b5_0/>, before <a2_0>the Locomotives on Highways Act 1896<a2_0/> abolished this law. In automobile races, the red flag is raised <a3_0>if there is danger to the drivers<a3_0/>. In international football, <b6_0>a player who has made a serious violation of the rules is shown <a4_0>a red penalty card<a4_0/> and ejected from the game.
